title: O'Kee's Healthy Gray Corned Beef Brisket from Scratch

instructions.1: Make brine: Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Stir in salt and sugar until dissolved; remove from heat and add cinnamon stick pieces, juniper berries, cloves, allspice berries, mustard seeds, peppercorns, ginger, and crumbled bay leaves. Let brine cool to room temperature, at least 1 hour.
instructions.2: Prepare corned beef: Place brisket in a large ceramic or glass dish deep enough to keep brisket submerged in brine. Pour brine over brisket; weigh it down to keep submerged. Cover the dish tightly with plastic wrap. Brine brisket in the refrigerator, checking brine level every day, 7 to 10 days.
instructions.3: Remove brisket from brine and rinse under cool running water; discard brine. Place brisket in a large slow cooker; add enough cool water to cover brisket by several inches and season with sea salt.
instructions.4: Cook on High for 2 hours. Add celery root, red potatoes, rutabagas, carrots, parsnips, and onions. Cook on Low until vegetables are softened and brisket is hot and gray in the center, about 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of brisket should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
instructions.5: Remove brisket to a cutting board and cover tightly with aluminum foil.
instructions.6: Arrange cabbage wedges into the slow cooker; continue cooking until all vegetables are tender, 20 to 30 minutes.
instructions.7: Slice corned beef into thin slices and serve with vegetables.

questions.question: In Step 4, is the brisket from Step 2 being used?
Is brine from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is brisket from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is vegetables from Step 4 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is parsnips from Step 4 still available in Step 7?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 4?
If we skip Step 4, is it still valid to use the vegetables in Step 7?
Can we remove (Step 3) and arrange (Step 6) at the same time?
